name: packages/core/src/abstract/index.ts
content: export * from "./store";

description: Get a block by given height

description: Get a block by given id

getBlockByTimestamp
description: Get a block by given timestamp

params.name: timestamp
params.description: The timestamp in seconds since Genesis Block

getBlockId

compose

getServerStatus

name: packages/core/src/burstService.ts
BurstService
description:
Generic BRS Web Service class.
Extend and specific services here

name: toBRSEndpoint
description: Mounts a BRS conform API endpoint of format `<host>?requestType=getBlock&height=123`

name: constructor
description: Creates Service instance

params.name: baseUrl
params.description: The host url of web service

params.name: relativePath
params.description: The relative path will be prepended before each url created with toBRSEndpoint()

name: query
description: Requests a query to BRS

name: packages/core/src/burstUtil.ts
BurstUtil
description:
The BurstUtil class provides static methods for encoding and decoding numeric ids.
In addition, addresses can be checked for validity.

name: encode
description: Encode a numeric id into BURST-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXX

name: decode
description: Decode BURST-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXX into numeric Id

name: isValid
description: Check for valid Burst address (format: BURST-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXX, XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXX)

name: splitBurstAddress
description: Split the Burst address string into an array of 4 parts

name: constructBurstAddress
description: Construct a Burst address from a string array

name: isBurstcoinAddress
description: Validation Check. Quick validation of Burst addresses included

name: convertStringToNumber
description: Helper method to convert a String to number

name: convertNumberToString
description: Helper method to Number to String(8 decimals) representation

packages/crypto/src/converter.ts
intToBytes_
description:
Produces an array of the specified number of bytes to represent the integer
value. Default output encodes ints in little endian format. Handles signed
as well as unsigned integers. Due to limitations in JavaScript's number
format, x cannot be a true 64 bit integer (8 bytes).

name: packages/http/src/httpError.ts
packages/http/src/httpMock.ts
HttpMock
onGet
description:
Mocks responses for get methods
You may pass a specific endpoint as parameter to mock only selected endpoints.
This is very useful, when having methods that do several Http requests,
so you can mock them one on one.

The following code returns the same content on _every_ get call
```
  HttpMock.onGet().reply(200, [{login: 'foo'}, {login: 'bar'}]);
```

The next code returns the different content depending on the passed endpoint
```
  HttpMock.onGet('/foo').reply(200, {data: 'foo'});
  HttpMock.onGet('/bar').reply(200, {data: 'bar'});
```

name: onPost
description: Mocks responses for post methods

name: onPut
description: Mocks responses for put methods

name: onDelete
description: Mocks responses for delete methods

name: reset
description: Resets all mocked behavior

content:
# BURST Javascript Lib

[![lerna](https://img.shields.io/badge/maintained%20with-lerna-cc00ff.svg)](https://lernajs.io/)

This library provides common functionalities used by all platforms.

## Installation

```
npm install && npm run bootstrap
```

That's it!


## Running Tests

1. Single test run `npm run test`
2. Run in watch mode `npm run test:watch` 
3. Run end-to-end test `npm run test:e2e` 
| Keep in mind that these tests are slow as they run against true servers. And therefore, it cannot be guaranteed that all E2E tests always work
